definition: surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)
wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: They both have wingspans over 11 meters.
Condor dragons have wingspans of approximately three meters.
sentences.chinese: 禿鷹龍的翼展大概有三米。

sentences.english: The eagle measured six feet from tip to tip.
sentences.chinese: 那隻老鷹兩翼展開時從一翼端至另一翼端長6英尺。

sentences.english: The wingspan of an MQ1 Predator A model is 55ft.
sentences.chinese: MQ1掠奪者A型的翼展爲55英尺。

sentences.english: If it flew, its wingspan is likely to have exceeded 13 feet.
sentences.chinese: 如果會飛的話，它的翼展有可能超過13英尺。

sentences.english: The after skirt is the entire wingspan rudder.
sentences.chinese: 後緣是全翼展的方向舵。

sentences.english: The ScanEagle has a 10-foot wingspan and weighs about 40 pounds.
sentences.chinese: “掃描鷹”無人機翼展爲10英尺，重40磅。

sentences.english: It has a wingspan equivalent to the hand of a child.
sentences.chinese: 它有一個小孩的手翼展同等學歷。

definition: height (of person)/length of clothing from shoulders to bottom (tailor or dressmaker's measure)

pinyin: wo1 lun2 pen1 qi4 fa1 dong4 ji1

definition: driving force/impetus/thrust (of a boat or aeroplane engine)/repelling force
